between two properties so you say ok I have a source property I have a target property and then you establish a
relationship all right but this relationship well it's going to keep them synchronized but it's going to do
that in the loose manner ok so we call that a loose coupling in the contrary of
having my target equals my sauce which is a hot coupling all right here you
have a loose coupling what it means the loose coupling means that basically if
the garbage collector decides to collect the sauce all the target for that matter the data body is not going to oppose
that it's going to say yes that's fine all right so by doing that you're going to prevent memory leaks that's especially important
because you know that in dotnet if you create an event handler it's actually a hot coupling between the source and the
target of the event ok and so you might have some memory leaks because of that
while data bindings don't cause these kind of things so the advantages of
using mvvm and data bindings are multiple ones first of all because your objects are very decoupled it's very
easy to basically make smaller objects adding object is quite easy because
you're not going to interfere with your existing objects all right so it's easier to maintain your application this
way then it's also good for collaboration because typically you're going to have maybe one team working on
the view model one team on the model one team on the view alright and then they don't really need
